title: Album Page, "The Torrazzo, Cremona", October 4, 1887
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
markings: Verso, stamped in ink, bottom center of sheet: (inscribed in a large wreath, very smudged): Museum / for the / Arts / of / Decoration.
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, at top right corner: (inscribed in circle) 61; at bottom right below drawing: The Torrazzo - highest tower in Italy / 387 ft high / Cremona / Oct 4th 1887.
description: Narrow sheet depicting a tall, red brick Romanesque clock tower with crenellation and double octagonal cupolas.  The cupolas have pinkish walls with white blind arcades.  At the base of the tower is low roof over an arcaded wall.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "The Torrazzo, Cremona", October 4, 1887.
October 4, 1887. Brush and watercolor, graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-15.
